definition: to wiggle/to squirm/peristalsis (wave movement of gut wall)
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: Long grass tickled their legs like creepy crawlies.
sentences.chinese: 長長的草像蠕動的爬蟲使他們腿發癢。

sentences.english: Drinking ginger tea will help start a bowel movement.
sentences.chinese: 喝薑茶有助於促進腸胃蠕動。

sentences.english: Thirty black beche-de-mer mate, sea cucumbers mate, writhing and squirting.
sentences.chinese: 三十個黑糊糊的海蔘正在裏面蠕動噴射着。

sentences.english: These rhythmic waves of muscular relaxation and contraction are called peristalsis .
sentences.chinese: 這種肌肉舒張和收縮的有節律波動稱爲蠕動。

sentences.english: Such rigorous lack of feature-creep is rare.
sentences.chinese: 這種缺乏特徵蠕動的產品乃罕見之作。

sentences.english: Peristaltic pump filling, high precision, no drop, easy to clean, no pollution.
sentences.chinese: 蠕動泵灌裝，精度高，無滴漏，易於清洗。

sentences.english: LKP didn't influence the secretion of gastric acid in rats and gastrointestinal peristalsis in mice.
sentences.chinese: 對大鼠胃酸分泌和小鼠胃腸蠕動未見明顯影響。

sentences.english: When I am pinned and wriggling on the wall.
sentences.chinese: 如果我被釘住了，四肢蠕動於牆面。

sentences.english: Peristaltic pump and flowing colorimetric pond suck and release samples automatically.
sentences.chinese: 蠕動泵配合流動比色池自動吸樣，排樣。

sentences.english: The worm makes a quiet noise with its bristles as it moves.
sentences.chinese: 蠕蟲蠕動的時候，它的毛會發出輕微的聲音。

sentences.english: It is characterized by a return of peristalsis .
sentences.chinese: 它的特點是腸蠕動恢復。

sentences.english: Can you explain the reasons why eating lots of fruits and vegetables causes frequent bowel movements?
sentences.chinese: 爲何食用過多的蔬菜水果會引起頻繁的腸蠕動呢？

sentences.english: The liquids are pumped with a peristaltic pump.
sentences.chinese: 液體是用蠕動泵來注入的。

sentences.english: Motion can enhance gastric bowel peristalsis, reduce costive happening.
sentences.chinese: 運動可以增強胃腸蠕動，減少便祕的發生。

definition: the body/organism (usually human)/(fig.) fabric (of society etc)/cohesive structure (of an entity)
within the body/in vivo (vs in vitro)/internal to
